medal.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a flat piece of metal, usually shaped like a coin, that is given to someone who has won a competition or who has done something brave
medal.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: She won a gold medal at the last Olympics.
The two boys were awarded medals for bravery.
medal.translation[0].note_box[0].section: They won a medal at the Chelsea Flower Show.
German runner Stephan Freigang took the bronze medal.
She received a medal from the Society of Arts.
He was given a medal for his courageous actions.
The book was awarded the Carnegie Medal.
He won the gold medal in Athens in 2004.
She was awarded the silver medal for the 100 metres.
Morrell took the bronze medal in  the long jump.
Johnson was a silver medal winner at the Olympic Games.
medal.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to win a medal at a competition, especially at the Olympic Games
medal.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Germany has the potential to medal in gymnastics this year.
